text.div:
LocationType

This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the physical form of the Location.

This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/location-physical-type defines the following codes:

Code Display Definition
bu Building Any Building or structure. This may contain rooms, corridors, wings, etc. It may not have walls, or a roof, but is considered a defined/allocated space.
wi Wing A Wing within a Building, this often contains levels, rooms and corridors.
lvl Level A Level in a multi-level Building/Structure.
co Corridor Any corridor within a Building, that is not within.
ro Room A space that is allocated as a room, it may have walls/roof etc., but does not require these.
bd Bed A space that is allocated for sleeping/laying on.
ve Vehicle A means of transportation.
ho House A residential dwelling. Usually used to reference a location that a person/patient may reside.
ca Cabinet A container that can store goods, equipment, medications or other items.
rd Road A defined path to travel between 2 points that has a known name.
jdn Jurisdiction A wide scope that covers a conceptual domain, such as a Nation (Country wide community or Federal Government - e.g. Ministry of Health), Province or State (community or Government), Business (throughout the enterprise), Nation with a business scope of an agency (e.g. CDC, FDA etc.) or a Business segment (UK Pharmacy).
area Area A defined boundary, such as a state, region, country, county

name: LocationType
description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the physical form of the Location.

concept.definition: Any Building or structure. This may contain rooms, corridors, wings, etc. It may not have walls, or a roof, but is considered a defined/allocated space.
A Wing within a Building, this often contains levels, rooms and corridors.
A Level in a multi-level Building/Structure.
Any corridor within a Building, that is not within.
A space that is allocated as a room, it may have walls/roof etc., but does not require these.
A space that is allocated for sleeping/laying on.
A residential dwelling. Usually used to reference a location that a person/patient may reside.
A container that can store goods, equipment, medications or other items.
A defined path to travel between 2 points that has a known name.

A wide scope that covers a conceptual domain, such as a Nation (Country wide community or Federal Government - e.g. Ministry of Health),  Province or State (community or Government), Business (throughout the enterprise), Nation with a business scope of an agency (e.g. CDC, FDA etc.) or a Business segment (UK Pharmacy).
A defined boundary, such as a state, region, country, county
